verbose_text: CXCL13 is highly relevant in the pathogenesis of RA, as high CXCL13 expression levels in the RA synovium have been associated with a lymphoid synovial phenotype; CXCL13 is more frequently observed in patients with RA who express anti-citrullinated protein antibodies and is a marker of more severe disease [XREF_BIBR].
